gis_tools module¶

gis_tools.applyPixelToReal(input_raster, input_csv, output_csv)¶

This is a convenience function to transform all detections in pixel coordinates to real world coordinates.

Parameters

  • input_raster (str) – Filepath to a georeferenced raster.

  • input_csv (str) – Filepath to an input .csv with Hough detections.

  • output_csv (str) – Filepath to output .csv.

Returns

Returns 0 if file successfully created, otherwise returns 1.

Return type

int

gis_tools.detectionsFromPoints(input_csv, output_shp, buffer_col='r', epsg_code='EPSG:3310')¶

This is a convenience function for converting my Hough detections to polygons based off radius.

Parameters

  • input_csv (str) – Filepath to an input .csv created by Hough tools

  • ouput_shp – Filepath to desired output .shp

  • buffer_col (str) – Used to show what variable should be used to determine the buffer, defaults to ‘r’ (radius)

  • epsg_code (str) – The EPSG code of the input coordinate system, defaults to ‘EPSG:3310’

Returns

Returns 0 if file successfully created, otherwise returns 1.

Return type

int

gis_tools.detectionsOnDir(input_dir, output_dir, csv_name='_real_coords.csv', buffer_col='r', epsg_code='EPSG:3310')¶

This is a convenience function for bulk conversion. Needs some refactoring tbh.

Parameters

  • input_dir (str) – Filepath to an input directory with .csv’s created by Hough tools

  • ouput_dir – Filepath to directory where output .shp’s will be saved.

  • csv_name (str) – The ending target for .csv’s, defaults to ‘_real_coords.csv’

  • buffer_col (str) – Used to show what variable should be used to determine the buffer, defaults to ‘r’ (radius)

  • epsg_code (str) – The EPSG code of the input coordinate system, defaults to ‘EPSG:3310’

Returns

Returns 0 if file successfully created, otherwise returns 1.

Return type

int

gis_tools.findSketchyCircles(input_gdf, weight_thresh=0.4, size_quant=0.9)¶

This is a convenience function to select circles that need more review.

Parameters

  • input_gdf – A set of geometries with weights (output from Hough step 1).

  • weight_thresh (float) – Any polygon with a weight >= to the threshold will be included.

  • size_quant (float) – The upper quantile of circle sizes to be included.

Returns

Returns a GeoDataFrame containing the circles needed for more review.

Return type

geopandas GeoDataFrame

gis_tools.getCoordinates(input_raster)¶

This function uses GDAL to get the coordinates and pixel resolution from a georeferenced image.

Parameters

input_raster (str) – Filepath to a georeferenced raster.

Returns

Returns a 3 element list containing the latitude, longitude, and pixel resolution.

Return type

list[lat, lon, pixel_res]

gis_tools.pixelToReal(lat, lon, pixel_res, pix_x, pix_y, rad)¶

This function transforms pixel coordinates (and radius) into realworld coordinates.

Parameters

  • lat (float) – Latitude of upper left pixel

  • lon (float) – Longitude of upper left pixel

  • pixel_res (float) – Pixel resolution of real world coordinates

  • pix_x (int) – x position of pixel coordinate

  • pix_y (int) – y position of puxel coordinate

Returns

Returns a 3 element list containing the latitude, longitude, and radius in real world coordinates.

Return type

list[lat, lon, pixel_res]

gis_tools.polyMasks(input_shp, img_path, output_dir)¶
gis_tools.polysToBoundingBoxes(input_gdf)¶
This is a convenience function to get the bounding boxes of a bunch of

polygons.

Parameters

input_gdf – A set of geometries with weights (output from Hough step 1).

Returns

Returns a GeoDataFrame of the bounding boxes from the input.

Return type

geopandas GeoDataFrame
